column4: i am usig centos right now and i have issues with their packages. some are installed with yum and some with using rpm.  is ubuntu done somewhat this way too or just with apt-get?
yum is a rpm front end and doesn't install anything. apt-get gets the packages and does conflict resolution while all packages are installed via dpkg
depends what you do,but yes there is. but you can then uninstall this package via apt-get again if you want to
can you give me example on how to use dkpg to start with
